sect4.title: basename
sect4.para: basename supprime les répertoires et les suffixes des noms de fichier.

sect4.title: cat
sect4.para: cat concatène des fichiers ou l'entrée standard vers la sortie standard.

sect4.title: chgrp
sect4.para: chgrp change le groupe propriétaire de chaque fichier donné par le groupe nommé, qui peut être soit un nom de groupe soit l'identifiant numérique du groupe.

sect4.title: chmod
sect4.para: chmod change les droits sur chaque fichier donné en accord avec le mode, qui peut être soit une représentation symbolique des changements à faire soit un nombre octal représentant les bits des nouveaux droits.

sect4.title: chown
sect4.para: chown change l'utilisateur et/ou le groupe propriétaires de chaque fichier donné.

sect4.title: chroot
sect4.para: chroot exécute une commande ou un shell interactif avec un répertoire racine spécial.

sect4.title: cksum
sect4.para: cksum affiche la somme de contrôle CRC et le nombre d'octets pour chaque fichier donné.

sect4.title: comm
sect4.para: comm compare deux fichiers triés ligne par ligne.

sect4.title: cp
sect4.para: cp copie des fichiers d'un endroit à un autre.

sect4.title: csplit
sect4.para: csplit envoie des pièces d'un fichier séparées par un ou des modèles vers des fichiers xx01, xx02, ..., et affiche le nombre d'octets envoyés pour chaque pièce sur la sortie standard.

sect4.title: cut
sect4.para: cut prints selected parts of lines from specified files to standard output.

sect4.title: date
sect4.para: date displays the current time in a specified format, or sets the system date.

sect4.title: dd
sect4.para: dd copies a file (from the standard input to the standard output, by default) with a user-selectable blocksize, while optionally performing conversions on it.

sect4.title: df
sect4.para: df displays the amount of disk space available on the filesystem containing each file name argument. If no file name is given, the space available on all currently mounted filesystems is shown.

sect4.title: dir, ls and vdir
sect4.para: dir and vdir are versions of ls with different default output formats. These programs list each given file or directory name. Directory contents are sorted alphabetically. For ls, files are, by default, listed in columns sorted vertically if the standard output is a terminal; otherwise they are listed one per line. For dir, files are, by default, listed in columns sorted vertically. For vdir, files are, by default, listed in long format.

sect4.title: dircolors
sect4.para: dircolors outputs commands to set the LS_COLOR environment variable. The LS_COLOR variable is use to change the default color scheme used by ls and related utilities.

sect4.title: dirname
sect4.para: dirname strips non-directory suffixes from file name.

sect4.title: du
sect4.para: du displays the amount of disk space used by each file or directory listed on the command-line and by each of their subdirectories.

sect4.title: echo
sect4.para: echo displays a line of text.

sect4.title: env
sect4.para: env runs a program in a modified environment.

sect4.title: expand
sect4.para: expand converts tabs in files to spaces, writing to standard output.

sect4.title: expr
sect4.para: expr evaluates expressions.

sect4.title: factor
sect4.para: factor prints the prime factors of all specified integer numbers.

sect4.title: false
sect4.para: false always exits with a status code indicating failure.

sect4.title: fmt
sect4.para: fmt reformats each paragraph in the specified file(s), writing to standard output.

sect4.title: fold
sect4.para: fold wraps input lines in each specified file (standard input by default), writing to standard output.

sect4.title: groups
sect4.para: groups prints a user's group memberships.

sect4.title: head
sect4.para: head prints the first xx (10 by default) lines of each specified file to standard output.

sect4.title: hostid
sect4.para: hostid prints the numeric identifier (in hexadecimal) for the current host.

sect4.title: id
sect4.para: id prints the effective user and group IDs of the current user or a given user.

sect4.title: install
sect4.para: install copies files and sets their permission modes and, if possible, their owner and group.

sect4.title: join
sect4.para: join joins lines of two files on a common field.

sect4.title: ln
sect4.para: ln makes hard or soft (symbolic) links between files.

sect4.title: logname
sect4.para: logname prints the current user's login name.

sect4.title: md5sum
sect4.para: md5sum prints or checks MD5 checksums.

sect4.title: mkdir
sect4.para: mkdir creates directories with a given name.

sect4.title: mkfifo
sect4.para: mkfifo creates a FIFO with each given name.

sect4.title: mknod
sect4.para: mknod creates a FIFO, character special file or block special file with the given file name.

sect4.title: mv
sect4.para: mv moves files from one directory to another or renames files, depending on the arguments given to mv.

sect4.title: nice
sect4.para: nice runs a program with modified scheduling priority.

sect4.title: nl
sect4.para: nl writes each specified file to standard output, with line numbers added.

sect4.title: nohup
sect4.para: nohup runs a command immune to hangups, with output to a log file.

sect4.title: od
sect4.para: od writes an unambiguous representation, octal bytes by default, of a specified file to standard output.

sect4.title: paste
sect4.para: paste writes lines consisting of the sequentially corresponding lines from each specified file, separated by TABs, to standard output.

sect4.title: pathchk
sect4.para: pathchk checks whether file names are valid or portable.

sect4.title: pinky
sect4.para: pinky is a lightweight finger utility which retrieves information about a certain user.

sect4.title: pr
sect4.para: pr paginates or columnates files for printing.

sect4.title: printenv
sect4.para: printenv prints all or part of the environment.

sect4.title: printf
sect4.para: printf formats and prints data (the same as the C printf function).

sect4.title: ptx
sect4.para: ptx produces a permuted index of file contents.

sect4.title: pwd
sect4.para: pwd prints the name of the current/working directory.

sect4.title: rm
sect4.para: rm removes files or directories.

sect4.title: rmdir
sect4.para: rmdir removes directories, if they are empty.

sect4.title: seq
sect4.para: seq prints numbers in a certain range with a certain increment.

sect4.title: shred
sect4.para: shred deletes a file securely, overwriting it first so that its contents can't be recovered.

sect4.title: sleep
sect4.para: sleep delays for a specified amount of time.

sect4.title: sort
sect4.para: sort writes sorted concatenation of files to standard output.

sect4.title: split
sect4.para: split outputs fixed-size pieces of an input file to PREFIXaa, PREFIXab, ...

sect4.title: stty
sect4.para: stty changes and prints terminal line settings.

sect4.title: su
sect4.para: su runs a shell with substitute user and group IDs.

sect4.title: sum
sect4.para: sum prints checksum and block counts for each specified file.

sect4.title: sync
sect4.para: sync forces changed blocks to disk and updates the super block.

sect4.title: tac
sect4.para: tac writes each specified file to standard output, last line first.

sect4.title: tail
sect4.para: tail print the last xx (10 by default) lines of each specified file to standard output.

sect4.title: tee
sect4.para: tee reads from standard input and writes to standard output and files.

sect4.title: test
sect4.para: test checks file types and compares values.

sect4.title: touch
sect4.para: touch changes the access and modification times of each given file to the current time. Files that do not exist are created empty.

sect4.title: tr
sect4.para: tr translates, squeezes, and/or deletes characters from standard input, writing to standard output.

sect4.title: true
sect4.para: true always exits with a status code indicating success.

sect4.title: tsort
sect4.para: tsort writes totally ordered lists consistent with the partial ordering in specified files.

sect4.title: tty
sect4.para: tty prints the file name of the terminal connected to standard input.

sect4.title: uname
sect4.para: uname prints system information.

sect4.title: unexpand
sect4.para: unexpand converts spaces in each file to tabs, writing to standard output.

sect4.title: uniq
sect4.para: uniq removes duplicate lines from a sorted file.

sect4.title: uptime
sect4.para: uptime tells how long the system has been running.

sect4.title: users
sect4.para: users prints the user names of users currently logged in to the current host.

sect4.title: wc
sect4.para: wc prints line, word and byte counts for each specified file and a total line, if more than one file is specified.

sect4.title: who
sect4.para: who shows who is logged on.

sect4.title: whoami
sect4.para: whoami prints the user name associated with the current effective user ID.

sect4.title: yes
sect4.para: yes outputs 'y' or a given string repeatedly, until killed.
